oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Down South - 1941-04-02 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: NBC syndication Down South, originating from WSM. Originally broadcast 1941-04-02, part 1. Features performances by the Fisk Jubilee Singers, Kitty Kallen, and an unidentified orchestra (most likely the WSM Orchestra).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Fisk Jubilee Singers; Kitty Kallen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Theme (I Wish I Was In Dixie) -- Announcer opening statement -- [Unidentified musical excerpt] -- Announcer introduces the Fisk Jubilee Singers -- Some Of These Mornings (Fisk Jubilee Singers) -- Announcer talks about the music library at the Hermitage -- [Unidentified orchestral piece] -- Old Rockin' Chair (excerpt) (Kitty Kallen) -- Announcer introduces Kitty Kallen -- Old Rockin' Chair (Kitty Kallen) -- Announcer talks -- Turkey In The Straw -- Announcer talks -- Good News, The Chariot's Coming (Fisk Jubilee Singers) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Down south (Radio program); Jubilee Singers; Kallen, Kitty
